intro: Rochefortia lundellii, commonly known as the Mexican devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after species among horticulturists. Rochefortia lundellii is also valued for its ability to withstand drought conditions, making it suitable for arid landscapes.
